channel.title: HELP . Please
channel.description: Okay so I'm trying to make my server, and im stuck at the enviromental variables part. I recently downloaded, JDK 6 update 18, and I followed instructions on what to do. For user variables, I put : Variable: Classpath Value: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18 Again for user variables I put : Variable : Path Value : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin Yet it still gives me the error of java not recognized as in internal or external command.

item.title: HELP . Please
item.dc:creator: @TapSumBong TapSumBong
item.description:
@TapSumBong wrote:

Yay, another freaking error. -_____-.
‘C:/Program’
is not a recognized file internal BLABLABLA

Read full topic

item.title: HELP . Please
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“TapSumBong, post:3, topic:327763”]I’m sorry that I’m a noob, but can you be a little bit more precise ?
When I edit runserver it says : @echo off
title JC-SCAPE 525
java -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar com.rs2hd.Main
pause
What should I change ?[/quote]

java

Right below JC-SCAPE

item.title: HELP . Please
item.dc:creator: @TapSumBong TapSumBong
item.description:
@TapSumBong wrote:

I’m sorry that I’m a noob, but can you be a little bit more precise ?
When I edit runserver it says : @echo off
title JC-SCAPE 525
java -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar com.rs2hd.Main

item.title: HELP . Please
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

than go into your runserver files and compiler files and replace java and javac with

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe”

and

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\javac.exe”

Read full topic

item.title: HELP . Please
item.dc:creator: @TapSumBong TapSumBong
item.description:
@TapSumBong wrote:

Okay so I’m trying to make my server, and im stuck at the enviromental variables part.
I recently downloaded, JDK 6 update 18, and I followed instructions on what to do.
For user variables, I put : Variable: Classpath Value: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18
Again for user variables I put : Variable : Path Value : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin
Yet it still gives me the error of java not recognized as in internal or external command.

Read full topic
